instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't start off battery
threads.message:
Hi,
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't start off battery.
Starts off AC and will run off battery. Shows charging battery.
?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't start off battery
threads.message: Power button working? Battery known good? Percentage going up when charging? <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> checked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't start off battery
threads.message:
Hi Duke,
I verified Power Button works and battery is charging fast.
Liquid spill on machine. Original battery shows a charge but BAD when I checked it with good machine. The battery Im using is good.
Noticed that <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> has gunk around it. Also <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR>. I checked the <RESISTOR>R7086</RESISTOR> 332.5k is good and connections are good. Im going to run the board through a cleaner see what happens.
Any suggestions?
Thanks Duke,
Rick

I ran the board through the Crest and no difference.
ideas?
Zapped the Pram 4 times and smc reset now working! F
Learning experience!
Thanks Duke!!!
